cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest, forecast to turn northwest and slow, tracking toward the middle Texas coast and then stalling near the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor/Matagorda area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande and north of San Luis Pass to High Island TX; Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Matagorda TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Matagorda to High Island TX and south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast with effects spreading into southwestern and central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible late weekend
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible along Louisiana coast near Morgan City, minimal effect at the inland port
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–12 inches of rain possible across central Louisiana, producing freshwater flooding and potential rising river levels near the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged heavy rain could cause river flooding, road closures, and supply-chain interruptions impacting port logistics
